intro: Schizotheca tatarica, commonly known as the Tatarian thimbleweed, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Asia and Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in a spherical shape, forming a distinctive inflorescence. Schizotheca tatarica is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
